tourBios.carHigh: Has never teed it up on the PGA TOUR. 2012: Made the cut in 14 of 25 starts and had four top-10 finishes that propelled him to finish No. 43 on the money list...First top-10 of the season came at the Soboba Golf Classic. Opened with a 69-67-64 and held the 54-hole lead by three strokes over Josh Broadaway. Let the victory slip away when he shot a final-round 73 to drop to T7...Three weeks later, again held the 54-hole lead, by one shot at the Stadion Classic at UGA. Opened 67-68-65 in Athens, Ga., and led a trio of players by one. Again came up short in his bid for victory, shooting a Sunday 70 to finish solo fifth to fall by three shots to Hudson Swafford...Had a strong performance at the Mexico Open in June. Entered the final round at El Bosque CC in solo fifth, shot a 1-under 71 in the final round and T4 at 11-under, three strokes behind Lee Williams...Made the cut in just three of his final 12 starts but managed a solo sixth at the Albertsons Boise Open, which pushed him back to No. 27 on the money list at the time...Missed his next four cuts and wound up No. 43 on the final money list after a 59th-place finish at the Web.com Tour Championship to end the season. 2011: Made the cut in 12 of 25 starts and had six top-25 fiinishes. Best of the year was a T8 at the weather-plagued Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open, which was ultimately reduced to 36 holes. 2010: Finished 55th at the WNB Golf Classic, the only cut he made in five starts. 2009: Finished No. 89 on the Web.com Tour money list. Finished the Monday qualifier at the Soboba Classic in California, where he T3, with four rounds in the 60s. Top-25 effort qualified him for the Chattanooga Classic the following week. Paycheck of $58,000 was enough to earn Special Temporary Membership status. Followed with a T19 in Tennessee, which earned him a start in the Miccosukee Championship the next week. Missed the cut in South Florida...Also made three starts on the European Tour, finishing T4 at the Johannesburg Open, T51 at the South African Open and 70th at the Dunhill Championship...Played in the Long Beach Open in California in August, cruising to a seven-stroke victory at El Dorado GC. The victory was worth $29,000. Also played in the Dunhill Championship in 2006-08, finishing T58 in 2008, T52 in 2007 and T45 in 2006.
tourBios.personal: Favorite college team is the Oklahoma Sooners. Favorite movie is "Remember the Titans." Favorite food is steak. On June 19th, 2013, he became a U.S. citizen in a ceremony in San Diego, Calif., along with 750 other new Americans.

tourBios.exmtStatus: 34th on the 2015 Web.com Tour priority list
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Sophomore season on TOUR included eight made cuts in 20 starts, with a T15 at the Barracuda Championship his lone top-25 finish. Wrapped up the season No. 191 in the FedExCup standings, failing to advance to the Playoffs for the second consecutive season...Made six Web.com Tour Regular Season starts, with his best showings a T42 at the El Bosque Mexico Championship and a pair of T47s...In the Web.com Tour Finals, played the weekend in the first three, finishing T22, T69 and T39 to earn $14,512, which placed him 44th on the Finals' money list heading to the Web.com Tour Championship. Opening rounds of 67-69-66 at TPC Sawgrass had him T5 and inside the projected threshold to secure his 2015-16 PGA TOUR card with one round to go. Came through with his fourth round in the 60s on Sunday at TPC Sawgrass to claim a T5 finish, which moved him into 17th position on the Finals' 25 money list. Was one of five who played his way into a TOUR card at the Web.com Tour Championship. Was 34th in the final priority-ranking order. 

2013-14: Made 15 PGA TOUR cuts in 25 starts in his first year as a PGA TOUR member, collecting four top-25 finishes along the way. His best was a T16 at the HP Byron Nelson Championship in May. Finished 144th in the FedExCup standings, sending him to the Web.com Tour Finals to attempt to regain his exempt status...Was in solo sixth to start the final round of the first Finals' event, the Hotel Fitness Championship. Birdied five holes in a row to finish his front nine and was only one back of lead. Cooled down considerably on the back nine, bogeying four of last five holes to card a 72 for a T7. But a check for $32,500 was significant in his quest to regain his PGA TOUR playing privileges. Finished T41 at the Chiquita Classic and T54 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, then capped his Finals with a T11 at the Web.com Tour Championship to clinch his playing privileges.

2013: Finished the year making the cut in 13 of 25 Web.com Tour starts, with three top-10s and eight top-25 finishes. Earned his first top-10 finish of the year, a T8 in late-April at the South Georgia Classic...Finished T6 at the BMW Charity Pro-Am...Missed the cut in the first two Finals events at the end of the year, after winding up No. 49 on the season money list...Was T4 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship at Ohio State's Scarlet Course. Third-round 68 put him in a tie for second, three shots off the lead. But a 2-over 73 Sunday kept him from putting any pressure on eventual winner Seung-Yul Noh...Finished T57 at the Web.com Tour Championship to wind up No. 24 on the Tour's Finals' priority list, good enough for him to earn his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card.

2012: Made the cut in 14 of 25 starts and had four top-10 finishes that propelled him to finish No. 43 on the money list...First top-10 of the season came at the Soboba Golf Classic. Opened with a 69-67-64 and held the 54-hole lead by three strokes over Josh Broadaway. Let the victory slip away when he shot a final-round 73 to drop to T7...Three weeks later, again held the 54-hole lead, by one shot at the Stadion Classic at UGA. Opened 67-68-65 in Athens, Ga., and led a trio of players by one. Again came up short in his bid for victory, shooting a Sunday 70 to finish solo fifth to fall by three shots to Hudson Swafford...Had a strong performance at the Mexico Open in June. Entered the final round at El Bosque CC in solo fifth, shot a 1-under 71 in the final round and T4 at 11-under, three strokes behind Lee Williams...Made the cut in just three of his final 12 starts but managed a solo sixth at the Albertsons Boise Open, which pushed him back to No. 27 on the money list at the time...Missed his next four cuts and wound up No. 43 on the final money list after a 59th-place finish at the Web.com Tour Championship to end the season. 2011: Made the cut in 12 of 25 starts and had six top-25 fiinishes. Best of the year was a T8 at the weather-plagued Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open, which was ultimately reduced to 36 holes. 2010: Finished 55th at the WNB Golf Classic, the only cut he made in five starts. 2009: Finished No. 89 on the Web.com Tour money list. Finished the Monday qualifier at the Soboba Classic in California, where he T3, with four rounds in the 60s. Top-25 effort qualified him for the Chattanooga Classic the following week. Paycheck of $58,000 was enough to earn Special Temporary Membership status. Followed with a T19 in Tennessee, which earned him a start in the Miccosukee Championship the next week. Missed the cut in South Florida...Also made three starts on the European Tour, finishing T4 at the Johannesburg Open, T51 at the South African Open and 70th at the Dunhill Championship...Played in the Long Beach Open in California in August, cruising to a seven-stroke victory at El Dorado GC. The victory was worth $29,000. Also played in the Dunhill Championship in 2006-08, finishing T58 in 2008, T52 in 2007 and T45 in 2006.

Amateur: Was the 2002 NAIA national champion.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Finished T3 at the season-opening Frys.com Open one shot out of the Grillo-Na playoff. Was taken by ambulance to the hospital in the morning of the final round and treated for severe dehydration and vertigo. Made it back to the course in time for tee time and final-round 68.
tourBios.personal: Favorite college team is the Oklahoma Sooners. Favorite movie is "Remember the Titans." Favorite food is steak. On June 19th, 2013, he became a U.S. citizen in a ceremony in San Diego, Calif., along with 750 other new Americans.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T3rd at the Frys.com Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 18th in Driving Distance - Fairway Woo on the PGA TOUR.
